title: Custard Sauce
instructions: In two separate saucepans scald the milk and the cream and leave them where they will remain warm.

In the bottom half of a double boiler bring the water to a low simmer; in the top pan of the double boiler beat 6 egg yolks with ½ cup sugar until the mixture is thick and pale; continue beating until the egg/sugar mixture is well heated.  Beat in the scalded milk and cream, ⅓ cup at a time, alternating between the milk and cream.  Cook the custard, stirring, until it’s thick enough to coat the back of the spoon, but do not let the custard come to a boil.
Remove the pan from the double boiler and beat in the vanilla.  Continue beating the custard until the heat comes down to “lukewarm.”
Remarks:  This custard is for serving with the Steamed Yeast Biscuits (see Baking/Sweet Rolls).
Source:  Gourmet Holidays: , by Lillian Langseth-Christensen, Gourmet Magazine, January 1978.
